H3.text: what act did parliament pass after the boston tea party. Intolerable Acts

A4.text: The Intolerable Acts were a series of five punitive laws passed by the British Parliament in 1774 after the Boston Tea Party.

A5.text: The Boston Port Act was the first of the laws passed in 1774 in direct response to the Boston Tea Party.

A6.text: In Great Britain, these laws were referred to as the Coercive Acts.

A7.text: A fifth act, the Quebec Act, enlarged the boundaries... and was seen by the colonists as one of the Intolerable Acts.

A8.text: Text of the Massachusetts Government Act
